intro: Tristellateia madagascariensis f. euemarginata, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. The varietal form 'euemarginata' refers to its well-defined leaf margins, distinguishing it from other forms of the species.
